snippet: Roughly 600 refugees a day were arriving in the Greek islands, and that half of them were coming ashore in Lesbos, a picturesque tourist destination ill equipped to handle the flow.
abstract: United Nations officials report large number of refugees from Syria, Iraq and Afghanistan arriving at Greek island of Lesbos are straining resources of small tourist island; note arrivals have grown steadily by month in 2015, from 737 in January to more than 7,200 in May.
lead_paragraph: Roughly 600 refugees a day were arriving in the Greek islands, and that half of them were coming ashore in Lesbos, a picturesque tourist destination ill equipped to handle the flow.

headline.main: Greece: U.N. Warns That Migrants May Overwhelm Tourist Island of Lesbos
headline.print_headline: Europe; Greece: U.N. Warns That Migrants May Overwhelm Tourist Island of Lesbos
